quest.name: Boric's Choice
journal: Rurusha has something to ask of you.
objectives: Synthesize a gold core Deliver the gold core to Rurusha.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. So wonderful to see you again.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: We just received word our delivery of core materials has come into port.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Boric was just leaving to go and fetch them, but now that you're here, might I ask you to accompany him? I would be certain of the quality of these goods, and I trust your discerning artisan's eye.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Fantastic! Well, hurry along, you two.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Let's be on our way, then. The merchant said she would be waiting for us in Scholar's Harbor.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Sorry for sending you off when you've only just arrived, but I would leave nothing to chance with these supplies.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! This is the merchant I was telling you about.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT04136
dialogue.text: 'Ello, 'ello! 'Ow are you on this fine day? You're both from the Studium, yes?

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Why yes, we are actually. We've been sent by Professor Rurusha for─

dialogue.name: MERCHANT04136
dialogue.text: Ah, so you'd be 'ere for the minerals then. 'Ave a gander at 'em and let me know if they meet with your approval.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Well, they seem to be what we asked for. Any thoughts, Forename?

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Oh, that's great to hear! What a relief.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT04136
dialogue.text: Pleasure doin' business with you!

dialogue.name: NAMONOTAYAMONO
dialogue.text: Do you have the tome I recently ordered for the Studium? The order was placed under Namono Tayamono.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT04136
dialogue.text: Ah, Professor Namono! Always a pleasure. Of course I do!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT04136
dialogue.text: 'Ere it is. I hope it's to your likin'.

dialogue.name: NAMONOTAYAMONO
dialogue.text: Yes, this is indeed what I requested you acquire, though I must say its contents appear to be somewhat lacking.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT04136
dialogue.text: Deary me! Do you wish to return it, then?

dialogue.name: NAMONOTAYAMONO
dialogue.text: No, no. You did your job and deserve to be compensated accordingly.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT04136
dialogue.text: Thank you kindly. If there's nothin' else, I'll be on my way.

dialogue.name: NAMONOTAYAMONO
dialogue.text: Here, perhaps with this you will learn something about what constitutes worthwhile research.

dialogue.name: NAMONOTAYAMONO
dialogue.text: If it piques your interest, then feel free to visit me in my office. I would gladly welcome someone as determined as you to join my staff; we could do with another pair of hands.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: A compendium of linguistic research. I fear its contents are beyond me.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Archaeology has always been my preferred field of study. However, my marks in school often left much to be desired... To even call me a second-rate researcher would be flattery.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: But that mattered little to Professor Rurusha. She took me under her wing in spite of my shortcomings, and my performance greatly improved thanks to her tutelage.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: So much so, I was offered a position working at Saint Coinach's Find after graduation. But I couldn't accept it─I owe a great debt to the professor for all she has done for me. So long as she has need, I will remain at her side.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Alas, I don't feel I've been much help to her of late. Perhaps it would be for the best if I took on a few odd jobs for Professor Namono. At least then I would be contributing to the field in some way, however insignificant it may be...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Then Professor Rurusha would be all on her own.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Only you can decide how you live your life.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Namono would work you to the bone, you know.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Ugh, you are right... This is not a decision to be made lightly.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Apologies for my jabbering. You did not come all this way to hear my lamentations.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Come, let us return to the professor.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: I do hope the relic is restored soon... I fear the stress of this endeavor may be the death of me.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, you two. Everything went well I take it?

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Good to hear! Thanks again for lending us that discerning eye of yours.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: I say, Boric, what is that tome you have there?

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Oh, this? Er, well, we happened to run into Professor Namono when we met the merchant, and...

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: ...The tome he ordered seemed to underwhelm him, and so he shoved it into my hands. He, er, also asked if I might consider working for him.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Look at you! Getting scouted by other professors. You're coming up in the world, Boric.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Alas, he only wanted me to help out with odd jobs. I could never hope to aid anyone in deciphering ancient languages, as you well know...

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: I do wish he wouldn't put himself down like this. He contributes more than his fair share to my work, at the very least. But let us set that aside for now. The time is come for you to get to work on the core.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: If you should have need of additional materials, Boric will provide.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: I made a point of ordering slightly more than we needed just in case something like this happened. Here you go!

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: It's...beautiful. Go and show it to the professor!

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: We're so, so close. Let me know once you've finished making the core.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Well, that was nerve-racking work, but I've successfully replaced the old core with your new one. Now we need but pray that it works...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: For the briefest of moments, the Golden Dhyata took flight! Unfortunately, it immediately falls to the table. A rattling sound can now be heard coming from within.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Well, what do you know? It really can fly like an airship!

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: I can hardly believe my eyes! Are you certain it is not Allagan in origin? I can think of no other ancient civilization capable of fashioning such a mammet.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Hmm... Strange, though, that it continues to function poorly despite replacing all its parts.

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Which leaves us with what is now essentially a prohibitively expensive ornament.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: I'll grant you our results thus far are somewhat less than satisfactory, but this is not cause for panic.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Archaeology is at its most interesting when you come up against a hurdle like this!

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Don't you just love being challenged to solve a good mystery?

dialogue.name: BORIC
dialogue.text: Well...

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Only time will tell if the Golden Dhyata is truly a mammet, or simply someone's old plaything. But I could never forgive myself were I to move on to another project without first uncovering all our friend's secrets.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Just think back to the state we found it in, and yet it's now capable of flight for goodness' sake! We've made incredible progress.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: That said, the rattling noise just now does have me worried. Perhaps I made a mistake somewhere when inserting the new parts. We'll need to dismantle it once more and see if we can't deduce what went wrong.

dialogue.name: RURUSHA
dialogue.text: Until then, I bid you get some rest. I will let you know the very moment we have finished.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next request will be available from Rurusha upon reaching level 88 as a blacksmith, armorer, or goldsmith.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Normal-quality items crafted in the course of this quest serve no purpose and cannot be sold. It is recommended that you discard them.
